garments.source: Given by Mrs H. M. Shepherd
garments.description: Printed wool, trimmed with printed wool, lined with cotton, hand-sewn. Wool was a popular fabric for winter day wear, as seen in this example. The dress is printed in a complicated design of shamrocks on a lilac and brown chequered ground...

garments.creator: Unknown

garments.garment_type: Court Presentation Ensemble, skirt, train, three(3) bodices.
garments.creator: The House of Worth
garments.source: Purchase, Friends of The Costume Institute Gifts, 2007
garments.description: This particular gown was worn by Esther Chapin, whose great-great-granduncle was George Washington. Ordered with three bodices, it can be transformed into a dinner dress, a ballgown, and, as here, with the extraordinary train, into a court presentation gown. The spectacular voided velvet, woven in Lyons...

garments.collection: The Costume Institute of The Metropolitan Museum of Art
garments.creator: Elsa Schiaparelli
garments.description: This evening gown is a masterpiece of the Art Deco period, with its striking design of a stylized fish skeleton in white beads on a black silk crepe background.
